solution_line_template: A small knife is twice the amount of the utensils that costs ${utensils_cost} so the knife costs {knife_multiplier}*{utensils_cost} = $<<{knife_multiplier}*{utensils_cost}={knife_cost}>>{knife_cost}

All total, each little kit will costs ${mitts_cost} for mitts, ${apron_cost} for an apron, ${utensils_cost} for utensils and ${knife_cost} for a knife for a total of {mitts_cost}+{apron_cost}+{utensils_cost}+{knife_cost} = $<<{mitts_cost}+{apron_cost}+{utensils_cost}+{knife_cost}={kit_total_cost}>>{kit_total_cost}

Each kit costs ${kit_total_cost} and they are currently {discount_percent:.0%} off so that's a savings of {kit_total_cost}*{discount_percent} = $<<{kit_total_cost}*{discount_percent}={kit_discount}>>{kit_discount}
The kits are ${kit_total_cost} and they are ${kit_discount} off so they now cost {kit_total_cost}-{kit_discount} = $<<{kit_total_cost}-{kit_discount}={discounted_kit_cost}>>{discounted_kit_cost}
She needs to buy {num_kits} kits and each kit costs ${discounted_kit_cost} so that's {num_kits}*{discounted_kit_cost} = $<<{num_kits}*{discounted_kit_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
